reviewText: I loved it but in part this is because I remember Lum and Abner from when I was a  kid and because in fairly recent years i listened to rebroadcasts of their radio episodes on my way to work.  But even if you aren't familiar with Lum and Abner, I believe you will enjoy their down home brand of comedy.
If you like the radio version, it might take some minutes to get used to, but this old film grows on you as you watch!

Incorporated in 2004, QUALITY INFORMATION PUBLISHERS is an indie outfit based in Asheville, NC that sells dubs of public domain pictures but also specializes in rare and obscure movies and educational materials. They have an extensive online catalog, and a website that includes an 800 number and gmail addy. . The rural-flavored Lum and Abner radio program aired from 1932 to '54. Co'lum'bus Edwards and Abner Peabody were proprietors of the Jot 'em Down Store, in mythical Pine Ridge, Arkansas. Because of the 15-minute show's popularity, the town of Waters, AK was renamed Pine Ridge in 1936. The L&A franchise became a film series in 1940, with seven programmers in all issued-- THE BASHFUL BACHELOR was their second entry. SYNOPSIS-- Abner trades the Jot 'em Down's delivery truck for a racehorse and runs it against a nag owned by a hated business rival. Lum writes a marriage proposal note for Geraldine, but the Widder Abernathy gets it by mistake. Also recommended: TWO WEEKS TO LIVE, the third Lum & Abner film. Parenthetical number preceding title is 1 to 10 IMDb viewer poll rating. (5.8) The Bashful Bachelor (1942) - Chester Lauck/Norris Goff/Zasu Pitts/Grady Sutton/Constance Purdy/Irving Bacon/Benny Rubin

The rural-flavored Lum and Abner radio program aired from 1932 to '54. Co'lum'bus Edwards and Abner Peabody were proprietors of the Jot 'em Down Store, in mythical Pine Ridge, Arkansas. Because of the 15-minute show's popularity, the town of Waters, AK was renamed Pine Ridge in 1936. The L&A franchise became a film series in 1940, with seven programmers in all issued-- THE BASHFUL BACHELOR was their second entry. SYNOPSIS-- Abner trades the Jot 'em Down's delivery truck for a racehorse and runs it against a nag owned by a hated business rival. Lum writes a marriage proposal note for Geraldine, but the Widder Abernathy gets it by mistake. "Bashful Bachelor" is available on DVD. TWO WEEKS TO LIVE, the third Lum & Abner film, is on both VHS and DVD. Parenthetical number preceding title is 1 to 10 viewer poll rating found at a film resource website. The rural-flavored Lum and Abner radio program aired from 1932 to '54. Co'lum'bus Edwards and Abner Peabody were proprietors of the Jot 'em Down Store, in mythical Pine Ridge, Arkansas. Because of the 15-minute show's popularity, the town of Waters, AK was renamed Pine Ridge in 1936. The L&A franchise became a film series in 1940, with seven programmers in all issued-- THE BASHFUL BACHELOR (presented here by REEL ENTERPRISES) was the second entry. SYNOPSIS-- Abner trades the Jot 'em Down's delivery truck for a racehorse and runs it against a nag owned by a hated business rival. Lum writes a marriage proposal note for Geraldine, but the Widder Abernathy gets it by mistake. TWO WEEKS TO LIVE, the third Lum & Abner film, is also available from REEL ENTERPRISES. Parenthetical number preceding title is 1 to 10 viewer poll rating found at a film resource website. It was good ,however the radio programs out ranked the movie.
I really like these movies. It is fun to watch them. Thank you amazon prime.
you have to be a fan already to enjoy this...it's alot of silly going at a slow trot
Just as good as the radio program. Nice to be able to see them doing there "schtick".
Thanks for making this historic team available for those of us who were not alive to hear/see them when they were famous.

This picture would never make it today, that's for sure. Even when it was made, it probably didn't do too well. But these two were on the radio for years (right after Lone Ranger in LA). Watching a Movie of these same two was a memory trip for me. I liked watching it a lot, myself.  I think my kids would think it was dumb. But the grandkids would think it was funny.
The  same cast as the Lum and Abner radio show. A hilarious visual extension. No old radio fan should be without it.
These guys always give old fashion humor and show the pace of life from that era. It is typical Lum and Abner way of life.
